intro: Puffia gerrardii, commonly known as the mountain puffer, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, fluffy seed heads that resemble puffed rice, giving it its common name. It thrives in high-altitude environments and is adapted to cold, arid conditions. Puffia gerrardii is often found growing in rocky soils and is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value.
